intro: Godetia heucki, commonly known as the yellow godetia, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a vibrant touch to gardens. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Godetia heucki is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
